cis.monopoly.gamePlay

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis.monopoly.gamePlay.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a player. The playerID is the "key attribute" when defining a player. Players should not share a playerID, otherwise it will break the game. The balance is obviously what the player owns. The playPieceID is what determines the player color, however, it will soon identify each id with a related icon.
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Kyle Turske

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String playName,
              int playID,
              int playBalance,
              boolean inPlay,
              int playPosition,
              int playPieceID)
        Base player constructor.
        Parameters:
        playName - The name of the player. Will be used to identify each player outside of the system
        playID - The identifying value used in the GameController class
        playBalance - How much money is owned by the player
        inPlay - Determined whether or not this player is still in play. Set to false if this player was never in play or when they "lose." Losing conditions to be set for the next release.
        playPosition - Where the player is on the board.
        playPieceID - Used to determine the color of the piece on the board
